verses.verse: And as Jesus departed, he saw a man who was blind from birth.
His disciples asked him, saying, "Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?"
Jesus answered, "Neither this man or his parents sinned, on the contrary [it was] that the works of God might be made evident in him.
"I must be busy doing the works of him who sent me, while it is day. The night comes when no one can work.
"As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world."
After he said this, he spit on the ground and made clay from the spit, then he spread the clay on the eyes of the blind man and told him,
"Go and wash in the Pool of Siloam", which translated means "Sent." So he left, washed, and came seeing.
Then the neighbors and those who had previously seen him that was blind said, "Isn't this he who sat and begged?"
Some said that this is the one but others that he is similar to him. He emphatically said that I am [that man].
So they said to him, "How were your eyes opened?"
He answered and said, "A man named Jesus made clay, coated my eyes, and said to me, «Go to the pool of Siloam and wash,» so I went, washed, and I received sight."
Then they said to him, "Where is he?" "I do not know," he said.
They brought him, who used to be blind, to the Pharisees.
Now it was the Sabbath day when Jesus made the clay and opened his eyes.
So the Pharisees asked him again how he had received his sight. "He put clay on my eyes, I washed, and I see," he said to them.

Then some of the Pharisees said, "This man is not from God, because he does not keep the Sabbath Day." Others said, "How can a man who is a sinner do such miracles?" So there was a division among them.
So once more they ask the blind man, "What do you say about him who opened your eyes?" He said, "He is a prophet."
Now the Jews did not believe [the things] about him who had been blind and received sight until they called the parents of him who had received his sight.
And they asked them, saying, "Is this your son, whom you claim was born blind? How then can he now see?"
His parents answered them and said, "We know that this is our son and that he was born blind,
but how he now sees, we don't know or who opened his eyes, we don't know either. Ask him, he is an adult and can speak for himself."
His parents said this, because they were afraid of the Jews, for the Jews had already agreed that if anyone confessed that he was Christ, then he should be expelled from the synagogue.
That is why his parents said, "He is an adult; ask him."
Then again they called for the man who had been blind and said, "Give God the praise. We know that this man is a sinner."
He answered and said, "I don't know if he is a sinner. I do know that I was blind, and now I see."
So again they said to him, "What did he do to you? How did he open your eyes?"
He answered them, "I have already told you, and you didn't listen. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you want to be his disciples, too?"
Then they lashed out at him and said, "You are his disciple, but we are Moses' disciples.
"We know God spoke to Moses, but we do not know where he comes from."
The man answered and said to them, «This is really strange that you don't know where he comes from, yet he opened my eyes!
«Now we know that God doesn't listen to sinners, but if anyone is a worshiper of God and does his will, he listens to him.
«Since the world began, no one has heard that any one has opened the eyes of one born blind.
"If this man were not from God, he could do nothing."
They answered him and said to him, "You were wholly born in sins, and you teach us?" Then they threw him out.
Jesus heard that they had thrown him out and finding him said to him, "Do you believe in the Son of God?"
He answered and said, "Who is he, sir, that I can believe in him?"
Jesus said to him, "You have seen him, and he is the one talking with you."
He spoke out, "Lord, I believe," and he worshipped him.
Jesus said, "I came into this world for judgment, that those who do see may not see, and those who do see may become blind."
Those Pharisees, who were with him, heard this and said to him, "We aren't blind, too, are we?"
Jesus said to them, "If you were blind, you would have had no sin, but now you say, «We see.» Therefore, your sin remains."
